GOVERNOR DIRECTOR

Sherry Thomas-Cloud
GAIL'S HOUSE
1638 LAKE ST,
KALAMAZOO, MI, 49001-3170
Re: License #: CI390385656
Investigation #: 2023C0000461
Dear Ms. Thomas-Cloud:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis
Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
**This report contains quoted profanity**
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI390385656
Licensee Group Organization: Family & Children Services
Licensee Designee: Sherry Thomas-Cloud
Chief Administrator: Sherry Thomas-Cloud
Agency Name: GAIL'S HOUSE
Agency Address: 1638 LAKE ST
KALAMAZOO, MI 49001-3170
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 11/24/2023
Capacity: 6
II. METHODOLOGY

1

6/14/2023 10:00 AM Video Conference MDHHS Worker – No Findings
6/14/2023 10:12 AM Email Other

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/15/23, youth assaulted another youth by punching and
strangling youth. This resulted in injuries. Youth also damaged a
staff member's car in the parking lot of the facility.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
An attempt was made to interview Complainant/Law
Enforcement on 6/15/23, but no one answered the phone
number provided and there was not an ability to leave a
voicemail. MDHHS Worker spoke to Law Enforcement, who
stated they would provide their police report as documentation of
information they received during their contact with all parties
involved.
Attempts were made to interview Youth A on 5/17/23, 5/18/23,
6/14/23 and 6/15/23, but Youth A either refused contact or did
not return contact. MDHHS Worker was able to interview Youth
A on 5/17/23, but Youth A refused to allow Consultant to be part of
the interview.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/24/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported she,
Youth A and Youth C were outside in the back yard drawing with
sidewalk chalk and hanging out. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were outside
observing. Youth B reported Youth C was stepping on her artwork.
Then she and the other youth were all joking and messing around
2

with each other. Youth B reported she walked away because she
did not want to play around anymore. Youth A thought everything
was fine and asked why Youth B left. Youth B told Youth A she
needed space and to mind her own business. Youth B went with
Staff 1 to take a walk around the facility and then they went inside
the facility to get her medications and take a break. When they
were inside, Youth A began pounding on the back door and asked
to come in. Staff 2 opened the door and entered the facility with
Youth A and Youth C. Youth B reported she was sitting on the
couch and Youth A called her a “bitch”. Youth B stated she and
Youth A began arguing. Youth B stated Youth A took her shoes off
and ran towards Youth B while she was sitting on the couch.
Youth A was initially standing over Youth B, but then Youth B
pushed Youth A, which caused Youth A to sit on the couch. Youth
A began punching Youth B in the head and then Youth A put her
hands around Youth B’s neck and began choking her. Youth B
reported Youth C, Staff 1 and Staff 2 were trying to pull Youth A
off Youth B. When they succeeded, Youth B was able to get out
and she, Youth C and Staff 2 exited out the front door. Staff 2
brought Youth B and Youth C to the gym. Youth A was trying to
open the gym door, but she couldn’t, so eventually stopped. Youth
B reported after the incident, she was evaluated at the hospital
and Youth A was arrested. Youth B reported there’s nothing Staff
1 or Staff 2 could have done differently to protect her or get
involved sooner. Youth B reported they did the best they could
during the situation.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/24/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported she,
Youth A and Youth B were all playing outside in the backyard
when Youth B got upset and walked away. Youth C reported
Youth A thought Youth B was mad at her, so she was telling her
she didn’t have to be mad. Youth B told Youth A she was fine,
asked her to leave her alone and told her to mind her own
business. Youth B then left the yard with Staff 1. Youth A said she
was tired of “these kids disrespecting her". Youth A tried to open
the gate to leave the back yard, but Staff 2 stopped her. Then
Youth A wanted to go inside, so Staff 2 opened the door and Staff
2, Youth B and Youth C went inside. Youth C stated Staff 1 and
Youth B were already inside. Youth C reported Staff 2 opened the
door and went inside first to try and prevent anything from
happening. Youth C stated Youth A told Youth B she was a
“bitch”. Youth B responded by stating she did not do anything
wrong, and Youth A did not need to be so mad. Youth C reported
Youth A charged at Youth B and began punching Youth B in the
head and choking her. Youth C reported she, Staff 1 and Staff 2
3

were trying to help separate Youth A and Youth B. Youth C
reported she tried to push and pull Youth A, but it did not work, so
she ended up pulling Youth B off the couch instead. Youth C
reported she, Youth B and Staff 2 went out the front door and
went inside the gym. Youth C reported she was not sure how
Youth A got outside because Staff 2 shut the door behind them
and was blocking Youth A from getting out. Youth C reported Staff
1 stayed at the facility with Youth A. Youth C reported Staff 1 and
Staff 2 could not physically grab, push, pull or restrain Youth A
because they are not allowed to. Youth C reported Staff 1 and
Staff 2 were doing their best to try and protect Youth B, they could
only do so much.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/24/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported when the
incident began outside, she was in the medication room ready to
pass nighttime medications and all three youth were out in the
backyard with Staff 2. Youth C came into the facility to speak with
Staff 1 about the incident outside and get her nighttime
medications. While Staff 1 was giving Youth C her medications
and talking with her, Staff 1 heard Youth B and Youth A raising
their voices, so she asked Youth C to leave the medication room
and went to check on them. Youth B wanted to take a walk so
Staff 1 took her on a walk. After a short walk, Youth B wanted to
take her medications, so Staff 1 took her in through the front door.
Staff 1 reported Staff 2, Youth A and Youth C were no longer in
the backyard. Staff 1 reported she gave Youth B her medications
and asked if Youth B wanted time in her bedroom to de-escalate
herself, which Youth B refused. Staff 1 reported Youth B chose to
sit on the couch to de-escalate instead. Staff 1 reported she saw
Youth A, Youth C and Staff 2 entering the fence gate into the back
yard. Staff 1 reported she saw a pair of safety scissors on the
table and put those in her pocket in case things escalated. She
asked Youth B to go to her bedroom, but Youth B still refused and
stated she wanted to remain on the couch. Staff 2, Youth A and
Youth C entered the facility and Youth A immediately asked Staff
1 for the scissors. Staff 1 reported when she refused, Youth A
asked for an explanation and Staff 1 told her she could not have
any sharp objects if she was escalated. Staff 1 reported Youth A
did not like the response and began directing her verbal
aggression towards Youth B. Youth B and Youth A were telling
each other to stop talking to one another, but neither would stop.
Staff 1 reported she could sense Youth A was becoming more
escalated and might attack Youth B, so Staff 1 positioned herself
in between them. Staff 1 reported she walked backwards as Youth
A walked towards Youth B to stay in between them. Youth A then
4

went over Staff 1’s right shoulder and began punching Youth B.
Staff 1 reported she got her phone out and called 911. Youth A
punched Youth B in her head 2-3 times and immediately began
choking her with two hands. Staff 1 reported she was trying to
verbally deescalate Youth A while she was on the phone with the
police. Youth C was telling Youth A to stop and was trying to pull
Youth A off Youth B. Staff 1 reported she and Staff 2 were trying
to use an approved release technique to release Youth A’s hands
from Youth B’s neck. They all ended up falling to the floor and
Youth C helped Youth B off the floor and away from Youth A. After
Youth B was out of the way, Staff 1 instructed Staff 2 to take
Youth B and Youth C out the front door and to the gym so they
were safe. Staff 1 reported she used body positioning techniques
to keep Youth A from attacking Youth B, Youth C and Staff 2.
After Youth B, Youth C and Staff 2 exited the building, Staff 1
positioned herself in between Youth A and the front door so Youth
A couldn’t get out the front door. Youth A shoved Staff 1 into the
door a few times. Staff 1 reported Youth A was yelling she was not
the one who started this situation and Staff 1 was still trying to
verbally deescalate her. Youth A then went out the back door,
went into the backyard and exited the gate to go to the front of the
home. Staff 1 reported Youth A threw dirt at Staff 1’s car and then
took the salt bucket and threw it at her car. Staff 1 stated Youth A
was banging and pounding at the front door, but Staff 1 would not
let her in. Youth A went to the back door, pulled on the door
aggressively and broke it open. She grabbed Staff 1’s metal water
bottle and brought it outside. Staff 1 reported Youth A used the
metal water bottle to break the windows of Staff 1’s car. Youth A
also pulled off the metal gas cover, broke off the gas cap, pulled
the door handles and broke one of the door handles. Law
Enforcement arrived and spoke with Youth A before putting her in
the police car. Staff 1 reported she stayed inside until Law
Enforcement told her to come out. Staff 1 reported they always try
to separate youth into their rooms if things are becoming
escalated, but Youth B refused to go to her room.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/24/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he was
outside with Youth A, Youth B and Youth C while they were
drawing with sidewalk chalk and listening to music. Youth A and
Youth C were stepping on the chalk drawings outside and Youth B
did not like it. She looked upset, walked away, and sat on the slide
on the playground. After a few minutes, Youth B got up and
walked towards the facility and Youth A told her she “didn’t have
to be a baby” and “to stop acting like that”. Youth B was still upset
and cursed at Youth A. Youth A then went on a walk with Staff 1
5

to take a break. Staff 2 stated Youth A threw her shoes and said,
“fuck this bitch; I’m going to kill her”, lifted the latch to the gate and
exited the backyard to walk around the property. Staff 2 reported
he and Youth C walked after her. Staff 2 reported he was trying to
deescalate her while they walked around the property, but it was
not working. Staff 2 reported when Youth A could not find Youth B,
she went back into the backyard and began banging on the back
door of the house. Staff 2 reported he, Youth A and Youth C all
went into the house and Youth B was sitting on the couch while
Staff 1 was close by. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B began
having a verbal exchange and were cursing at each other. Staff 2
stated Youth A again repeated “I’m going to kill this bitch” and
Youth A charged at Youth B. Staff 2 reported he and Staff 1 were
trying to block Youth A from hitting Youth B and then Youth A
began choking Youth B. Staff 2 reported Youth C was trying to
help him and Staff 1 separate Youth A and Youth B, but it wasn’t
working. Youth C was eventually able to get Youth B out from
under Youth A and then Youth C, Youth B and Staff 2 exited
through the front door and went to the gym. Staff 2 reported he
shut the front door behind them when they left so Youth A could
not follow them. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was standing in between
Youth A and the front door to block her from following them. Staff
2 reported during the altercation, Staff 1 was able to call the
police, who arrived shortly after Staff 2, Youth B and Youth C
made it to the gym. Staff 2 reported he and Staff 1 did everything
they could to protect the kids without violating their restraint
policies and procedures. Staff 2 reported Youth A would not
respond to any of their instructions, prompts or de-escalation
efforts. Staff 2 reported they always try to separate youth into their
rooms if things are becoming escalated, but Youth B refused to go
to her room.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
5/24/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported the facility utilizes Mandt for restraints. There are no
approved Mandt restraint methods where staff can restrain a
youth on the floor or while sitting on the couch. Staff are not
allowed to push, pick-up, grab or pull a youth. Staff are allowed to
body block and conduct releases. The restraints they can do
include a side body hug, a two-person side body hug and a one-
arm restraint, but all of those need to be conducted when a youth
is in a standing position.
Supervisor, Administrator 1, and Administrator 2 were
interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/27/23 to review
video footage and the Mandt System Handbook. At
6

approximately 0:52 into the video, Youth A backed up from Youth
B. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were on either side of Youth B. Supervisor
reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 have been trained in Mandt. According
to Mandt, if the aggressive party voluntarily disengages from the
harmful behavior, no restraint should occur. In this situation, Youth
A voluntarily backed up and there was not an indication Youth A
was going to attack or be aggressive towards Youth B again.
Upon Youth A becoming aggressive again, Staff 1 and Staff 2
immediately began body blocking and positioning themselves to
protect Youth B. At the point Youth A reattacked, Staff 1 and Staff
2 could not restrain Youth A due to her positioning on the couch
as the restraints can only be done when a person is in a standing
position. At approximately 1:19 into the video, Youth A was
separated from Youth B, but Staff 1 and Staff 2 did not restrain
Youth A. Administrator 1 stated Mandt training teaches restraints
can only be utilized for imminent danger. Administrator 1 reported
since there was space between Youth A and Youth B and Youth A
was no longer attacking Youth B, there would have been no
reason to restrain Youth A. Administrator 1 noted after the youth
and staff fell off the couch and got up, Youth A never physically
touched Youth B again due to Staff 1 and Staff 2’s body
positioning efforts. Supervisor also noted Mandt teaches before a
restraint can be utilized, attempts must be made to remove the
stimulus. In this situation, the stimulus for Youth A was Youth B
and Staff 1 and Staff 2 made efforts and succeeded in removing
Youth B from the building.
VIDEO FOOTAGE REVIEWED:
Video footage from 5/15/23 was reviewed (Note: there is no
audio). Youth B is viewed to be sitting on the couch in Gail’s
House while Staff 1 walks around the living room area close by.
To the left side of the camera angle, you can see someone
approach the backdoor leading from the backyard into the facility.
Staff 1 walks over, approaches the table by the back door, grabs
an object off the table and puts it in her pocket. Youth A enters the
facility through the back door and is facing Staff 1 while they have
a conversation. Staff 2 walks around the table to the left of Youth
A and stands closer to Staff 1. Youth C is seen to be on the other
side of the table to the right of Youth A. Youth B remains seated
on the couch. Youth A and Staff 1 continue talking. Then Youth A
turns her body and faces towards Youth B sitting on the couch
and they exchange words. Staff 1 moves over so she is in
between Youth B and Youth A and begins backing up towards
Youth B. Staff 2 moves over and positions himself closer to Youth
A so he is in between Youth A and Youth B. Youth A then pushes
Staff 2 out of the way a couple times and charges towards Youth
7

B. Staff 1 positions herself right in between Youth A and Youth B,
while Staff 2 follows behind Youth A. Youth A pushes Staff 1 to
the right, goes over Staff 1’s left shoulder and begins punching
Youth B. Youth C begins to approach the situation. Staff 2 comes
around the back of Youth A, places his hands on Youth A’s back
and moves to her right side. Youth A then backs up and Staff 1
and Staff 2 try to position themselves in between Youth A and
Youth B. Staff 1 body blocks Youth A’s advances towards Youth B
and Youth A backs up again. Staff 2 then positions himself in
between Staff 1 and Youth A. Youth C walks over to the couch
near Youth B. Youth A walks to the right and then back to the left
while Staff 1 and Staff 2 are following along positioned in between
Youth A and Youth B. Youth A then shoves Staff 1 and Staff 2 out
of the way, sits on the couch and begins attacking Youth A. Youth
C is trying to get Youth A off of Youth B while Staff 2 is trying to
position himself in between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 pulls her
phone out of her pocket and is seen calling someone. Youth C
uses her body to try and shove Youth A off of Youth B and Staff 2
is continuing to try and get in a better position to separate Youth A
and Youth B. Youth C is seen pulling Youth B off the couch while
Youth A is still on top of her. Youth A falls off the couch to a
kneeling position, which pushes Staff 2 and Staff 1 over. Youth A
still has her hands on Youth B, so while Youth C continues to pull
Youth B away, it causes Youth A to fall on the ground, which then
causes Staff 2 to also fall on the ground. Youth C helps Youth B
off the ground. Youth A and Staff 2 both stand up. Staff 1 positions
herself in between Youth A and the other two youth while she is
still seen on the phone. Youth B and Youth C run towards the front
door. Youth A changes direction to go around the other side of the
couch since Staff 1 is blocking one side. Staff 1 and Staff 2 jog
around to get in between Youth A and the other two youth. The
pillar in the living room blocks the view of the front door so it is
difficult to see. At one point, you can see Staff 2 body blocking
Youth A from getting to the other two youth and Staff 1 says
something to Youth A while pointing in the opposite direction.
Youth A backs up and is seen taking her socks off while Staff 1 is
standing in front of the other two youth in the corner by the front
door. The front door opens and Youth B and Youth C run towards
the open door while Youth A charges at the door. Staff 1 positions
herself to block Youth A. You can see Staff 2’s shirt on the other
side of the front door and it is clear he also exited the building.
Youth A then throws something towards the front door, walks
towards the back door, and exits the back door.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
8

• Family & Children Services (F&CS) Emergency Restraint in
a Child Caring Institution Procedure (effective 5/31/22)
outlines the definitions and situations in which emergency
restraint may be utilized. It states staff may not utilize any
physical intervention techniques except for what they are
trained in by the Mandt System.
• Family & Children Services (F&CS) Behavior Support &
Management Policy (rev. 9/29/22) outlines the agency’s
philosophy of behavior support and management, with a
focus on positive behavior support. It also outlines
unapproved methods of behavior management, which
includes no hitting, striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing any part of an individual’s body.
• The Mandt System Inc. Student Workbook 1975-2017
states the intention of Mandt is not to fight power with
power. “The Mandt System believes that some physical
interaction skills may be used to assist or limit a person’s
behavior”. Chapter 9 teaches “Restraining means limiting,
but not immobilizing a person who has engaged in behavior
that is harmful to themselves and/or others”. “After the
people who were at risk are safe, the interaction should be
discontinued in a planned, purposeful approach”.
o Restraints that can be used in Mandt:
▪ One person, one arm standing restraint:
Client must be standing. One person must be
behind the client with arms around the client
holding one of the client’s arms close to their
body.
▪ One- or two-person side body hug: Client
must be standing. Client’s arms are held
against their body, while one or two people
are on either side of the client. The staff put
one of their legs in front of the client and each
hug the client from the side, holding down the
arm on the opposite side of their body.
• MiSACWIS Incident Report #154620204 dated 5/16/23
detailed the events from 5/15/23 and was consistent with
Staff 1’s interview.
• KDPS Police Report (Case Number: 23-006753) dated
5/25/23 outlines the police contact with all parties on
5/15/23. Report notes Youth A was arrested for Felonious
Assault (Assault by Strangulation), Assault and Battery
9

(Simple Assault) and Malicious Destruction of
Property>$1000. Report notes Youth A admitted to Law
Enforcement she punched Youth B in the face, strangled
her and damaged Staff 1’s vehicle.
• Email from MDHHS Worker detailing her interview with
Youth A conducted on 5/17/23. Initially Youth A refused to
meet with MDHHS Worker, cursed at MDHHS Worker and
shut the door in MDHHS Worker’s face. When MDHHS
Worker was leaving the facility, Youth A agreed to meet
briefly. MDHHS Worker noted Youth A was short and
abrupt in her responses. Youth A noted staff cannot
restrain anyone at the facility, so they stand close, tell the
youth to stop and try to get in between them to stop things.
Youth A reported on 5/15/23, everyone was having fun, but
then Youth B got serious, told her to “Get the fuck out of my
business” and there was a physical altercation. Youth A
stated “I choked her. Police came, because when there is a
fight here, they normally call police. Staff was right there”.
Youth A stated the police took a photo of her, took her
fingerprints, and took her to the hospital. Youth A reported
she did not have any injuries. Youth A abruptly indicated
she was done talking, got up and walked away.
• Staff 1 does not have any discipline in her personnel file.
She completed Mandt training on 3/8/23.
• Staff 2 does not have any discipline in his personnel file. He
completed Mandt training on 10/31/22.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and video footage reviewed, no
violation is found. The staff proactive in their approaches to keep
all youth safe. When things began to escalate, the staff reacted
appropriately, even when Youth A began escalating further.
Technical Assistance
• If another youth becomes involved in a situation to help
protect another youth, staff need to instruct youth to back
away and not get involved for their own safety.
• Staff are trained to perform physical restraints in Mandt.
Even if a youth is not in a perfect position to conduct the
restraint, staff need to assist the youth in getting into a
better position so the restraint can be conducted; if
warranted.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
10

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
June 15, 2023
Shannon Mavis Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
June 30, 2023
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
11
